dialogue.content: Two young man devoted to an illusion...
Two young men who never intended to hurt anyone.
Which of you brave souls is willing to bind this lovely young woman...
Are either of you two gentlemen gailors?
Well, I'm sure you can both tie a strong knot...

actions.content: Borden sits in the audience.	Younger- both hands intact.
Two rows in front sits Angier.	Similarly youthful.
Onstage is a TANK. Standing beside the tank is a beautiful young magician's assistant.	JULIA.The magician, MILTOn, adress the audience.

Milton GESTURES to Julia- the MEN in the crowd go wild- hands in the air, catcalls.	Smiling radiantly, Julia selects two young men, who SCRAMBLE up to the stage- ANGIER and BORDEN: younger, full of energy- Angier has no limp.They spring onto stage, beside Julia and take the ROPE she offers them.	Milton GRABS a HOOK that descends from the flies on a chain.Cutter is watching fron the wings.
Both shakes their hands as they start to bind Julia with the ropes, Borden wrapping the rope around her wrists, Angier the one around her ankles.

As Borden finishes his knot tests it, it SLIPS APART. Borden frowns, hastly RETYING it, covering.Cutter NOTICES.Borden finishes, glancing at julia who gives a small sign of assent with her eyes.	As Angier finishes tying her ankles he sneaks a light KISS on her ankle.	She frowns at him and raises her arms.	Milton hooks the rope onto the chain.Milton gesticulates	in the wings, Cutter signals to a stagehand who starts HOISTING Julia into the air.Milton wheels the tank under Julia's bare feet.	Cutter feels for the handle of an AXE placed by his feet and pulls out a STOPWATCH.JULIA looks down at Angier.	They smile at each other.	Julia DROPS into the tank with a massive splash- Milton SLAMS the lid shut, PADLOCKS it and raises a curtain around the tank...Cutter checks his stopwatch, grips the handle of the axe...A grand GESTURE from Milton- the curtain around the tank DROPS- Julia is GONE.	Milton raises the curtain again, then with another flourish, DROPS it to reveal JULIA, beside the tank, one arm in the air, dripping wet, smiling. The audience erupts in APPLAUSE. Angier smiles produly.

dialogue.content: Milton's squadering their goodwillor a bunch of tired second-hand tricks-
(amused)
Old favourites, please.
What about something fresh?	He won't even try a bullet catch-
Bullet catch is suicide.
All it takes is a smart-arse volunteer dropping a button down the barrel...
(indicates himself and Angier)
Use plants-
He can't use plants for every trick.
There'd be no seats left for the punters.
Fine- no bullet catch.	But a real magician tries to invent something new, something other magicians scratch their heads over-
They sells it to them for a small fortune.
I suposse you have such a trick, Mr.Borden?
Actually, I do.
Care to sell it?
No one else could do my trick.
I could.
You don't even know what it is.
Show it to me twice, I'll do it.
I admire your spirit, Mr.Angier.But if Borden here really has invented his masterpiece it might well be something only he can do.
Why?
It might be something only he isprepared to do.
(gestures to the props)

my illusions employer, Mr.Milton, is a skilled showman.	But Borden'sright- he won't get his hands dirty. You want to see what it takes to make real magic- go to the Tenley.There's a Chinaman there who's got what it takes.
Chung Ling Soo.
Tickets are pricey.
I know a lad on the door.	You two watch his show- whoever tells me how he does his goldfish bowl trick gets the prize.
Which is?
Ten minutes onstage in front of my old friend, Mr.Ackerman.
Who's Ackerman?
The most powerful theatrical agent in London.
I saw you drop the knot again, Borden.
I think I had my wrist turned-
(ignoring Julia)
Some nights you just can't get it, can you?	If that knot slips when Julia's on the hoist she'll break a leg.
(defensive)
It's the wrong knot.	A Langford double would hold tighter.
The Langford double's not a wet knot it's too dangerous. The ropes could swell and she'd never slip it-
I can slip a Lanford underwater.
We've been practiced it-
(cutting in)
He said no.
(to Borden)
No more mistakes.
Where's he from?
Where are you from?
He shuffles props for Virgil at the Hall.
He works for another magician?	Aren't you worried he'll steal your tricks?
(shakes head)
He doesn't deal in methods.
How do you know?
(sly smile)
Because I hired him to try and find out Virgil's orange trick.
I don't know if I trust him.
He's a natural magician.	Of course you can't trust him.
I think he's alright. Angier turns to Julia.	Smiles.
You think everyone's alright.
Even you.
(Angier looks up)
And Mr.Angier...?Learn your aight lines- if I can see you sneaking a peck on your wife's ankle from the wings, the blokes on each end of rows 3 and 4 can, too.

actions.content: Angier, Borden and Julia sit around the cluttered room. Borden is in the middle of a passionate rant-
They turn.	Cutter stands in the doorway, counting out money.
Cutter hands Angier some money.
Cutter looks at Borden, thoughtful.
Cutter gives a sly smile.
Angier and Borden prick up at the name.
Cutter holds out money to Borden, who reaches for it- Cutter grabs his wrist.	Serious.
Julia glances at Angier.
Borden stares at Cutter.	Leaves.	Angier watches him go.
Angier nods.	Fair enough.
Julia kisses Angier.	Cutter rises.

dialogue.content: Look- he's all right.	He's fine.
(sniffs)
But where's his brother?
Sharp lad, your son.
(laughs)
My brother.

actions.content: Borden watches from the wings.	Onstage, a magician, Virgil, locks a CANARY into a cage then covers the cage with a SHAWL.Borden notices a beautiful YOUNG WOMAN in the front row with a little BOY who is watching Virgil's act, spellbound.Virgil SLAMS the SHAWL down onto the table, as if nothing were beneath it, then WHIPS it away- BIRD and CAGE are gone.The little BOY begins to WAIL and CRY.Borden watches as the young woman tries to make him stop. Virgil takes the flower from his lapel, covers it with the shawl, and SNAPS it away- the flower has become the CANARY.The audience bursts into enthusiastic APPLAUSE, but the little boy is still CRYING INCONSOLABLY.	Virgil takes bows andwalks off, handing Borden the canary as he passes backstage. As the audience leaves, Borden climbs off the stage and hols the bird in front of the boy.
Borden is at a loss.	He turns to the young woman.
Borden smiles back.

dialogue.content: You're the lucky one tonight.Borden walks to a wall of DOZENS of bird cages -- each one with an identical canary.	He puts the bird into its cage and returns to the cart props.	He taps on the top of the

actions.content: Borden gently strokes the bird's feathered head.

TABLE- a panel POPS open, revealing the FLATTENDED BIRD CAGE.Borden insefts a ROD into the bird cage and PRIES it apart. A TRICKLE of BLOOD emerges, dripping into a bucket below.Borden SLAPS the cage.And the FLATTENED CARCASS of the ORIGINAL BIRD slides out and SPLASHES into the bucket.

dialogue.content: (to the brother)
Are you watching closely?
Look closer.
It's got two heads.
Never.	Show.	Anyone.
They'll beg you and flatter you for the secret- but as soon as you give it up you'll be nothing to them.Understand?	Nothing.	The secret impresses no one- the trick you use it for is everything.
Where do you two live?
He lives with Mum.
And you?

actions.content: Borden exits.	The young woman, SARAH, is there with her brother.
Borden reaches to the Boy's ear.	Casually produces a coin. The Boy marvels as he takes the coin then looks at Borden.
Sarah smiles.	Borden crouches to address the Boy, grave.
The Boy looks at him, a little afraid.
Borden looks into the boy's staring eyes.	Then SMILES and pets him on the head.	he stands.	Sarah smiles at him.

dialogue.content: Enough to keep me out?
I think so.	Wil I see you again?

actions.content: Sarah lingers at the top of the stairs to her flat.	Borden tries to KISS her, but she pushes him back.	He tests the LOCK of the open door.
Borden SHRUGS and turns to go back down the stairs.	Sarah looks after him, about to change her min.	Hesitates.

She closes the door and LOCKS it, smiling.	After a moment she pads through living/kitchen area, draws back the curtain to her bedroom and SHRIEKS:Borden is there, smiling.	Sarah moves towards him, giggling.

Onstage, CHUNG LING SOO, 60's, wearing a long silk robe, HOBBLES painfully to the center of the stage.	Clearly CRIPPLED.	In the audience, Borden and Angier watch intently. Soo lays a silk SHAWL and a BARE TABLE.	He WHIPS it up, revealing a BOUQUET OF ROSES.	So repeats the trick again and again, producing a different object each time.Finally, with a drum roll, Soo whips the shawl aside to reveal a MASSIVE GOLDFISH BOWL, complete with GOLDFISH.To THUNDEROUS APPLAUSE, Soo bows and HOBBLES off the stage. Angier, clapping, shakes his head, utterly baffled.	He turns to Borden.	Who has a small, knowing, smile.

dialogue.content: You're wrong.	It can't be.
It is.	He carries the bowl between his knees for the entire performance.
but look at the man!
(points)
This is the trick.	This is why no one detectes his method.
(looks at Angier)
Total devotion to his art...Utter self-sacrifice.	It's the only way to escape this.

actions.content: Borden and Angier watch Soo being helped down from his carriege by HANDLERS who treat him with great gentleness.
Soo hobbles into the restaurant, frail, and fragile.
Borden SLAPS the bricks of the wall behind them.

dialogue.content: I can barely lift this thing and it's not even filled with water.	Or fish.	He must be strong as an ox.
(incredulous)
He's been preteding to be an cripple for years?
Any time he's in public.	Any time he goes out.	It's unthinkable.
Borden saw it at once.	I couldn't fathom it- living your whole life pretending to be someone else.
You're pretending to be someone else.
I don't think changing your name compares.
Not just your name- who you are, where you're from...
I promised my family I wouldn't embarrass them with my theatrical endeavors.
I came up with a name for you... "The Great Danton"
(Angier frowns)
You don't like it?	It's sophisticated.
It's French.

actions.content: Julia, in bed, watches Angier, SHEET wrapped around him like a robe, HOBBLING. He pulls up the sheeyt- between his knees is a goldfish bowl.
Angier puts the bowl down with a flourish.	Climbs into bed.
Angier cuddles up to Julia.

dialogue.content: Alfred?!
We have our routine for Ackerman!
(cold)
We haven't had the pleasure.
Mr.Fallon is my ingeneur-Where did yo get all of-
Begged, borrowed	and don't ask. Mr.Fallon's an enterprising soul.
I need talk to you.
We can't afford to pay him-
We'll start making money once we have our audience-
And until then?	What I earn is barely enough for us.
(shrugs)
I'll give him half of my food.Sarah looks meaningfully at Borden.
You're already going to be sharing it with someone else.
You're...?
Having a baby.
What's this?
The trick to wake up Ackerman at the end of my audition.
Your great trick?	The "masterpiece that will make our fortunes"?
No. The world isn't ready for that one, yet.
This is merely a run-of-the-mill daring and spectacular bullet catch-
I'm not letting you get shot.Borden RAMS the bullet and charge down then removes the RAMROD and hands the pistol to Sarah.
It's perfectly safe.	Shoot me.
Show me.
(Borden shakes head)
Then you're not doing it.	I can't raise a child on my own, Alfred.
The bullet goes in the gun.	Then comes the ramrod.
And voils-
The buller's not even in the gun when the charge is fired.
Once you know it's so obvious.
Yes, well, people still get killed perfoming it.
How?
Sme smart-arse drops something down the barrel.
Such as?
A penny, or a button.	Or, of course, a bullet.
(off worried look)
But don't fret-Borden embraces her, putting his hand on her belly.
I'm not letting anything happen- I love you too much.
Say it again.
I love you.
(matter-of-fact)
Nope.	Not today.
What?
(smiles)
Some days, it's not true.	Todaytyou don't mean it.	Maybe today you're more in love with magic than me.
(off look)
It's alright.	I like being able to tell the difference- it makes the days it is true mean something.

actions.content: Sarah unlocks the door, but has to PUSH against MAGICAL PROPS stacked against it- the bedsit is FILLED with DEVICES.
Sarah surveys the confusion- spots Borden across the flat deep in conversation with another man.	Borden spots her-
The other man turns- it is Fallon.
Fallon nods.	Borden comes over, holding a DUELING PISTOL.
Fallon slips past Sarah with a nod to Borden.	Exits.	Sarah looks at Borden.	TENSE.
Borden looks at her, confused.	Then realizes.
Borden freezes. Then SMILES, taking her in his arms.	She FLINCHES against the gun he is holding.
Borden moves to the bureau and starts LOADING the gun. Pouring in SHOT, then WADDING...
Borden drops the BULLET into the barrel...

Sarah looks at Borden then down at the pistol.	She aims at Borden.	Then sims off, at a mirror beside him.BANG.	Borden's hand SNAPS out to "catch" the bullet.	The mirror is intact.Borden looks at Sarah, grave, as he reveals the bullet in his hand.
Borden looks at her.	Takes the bullet from her and places it on the bureau.
He takes the RAMROD and PUSHES it down onto the bullet, which disappears.
He points the ramrod at Sarah- she pulls the bullet out of the HOLLOW TIP.
Sarah looks at ramrod with disdain.
Borden BRISTLES slightly.	Takes the bullet back.
Sarah grabs his face, looking at his eyes, smiling.
Borden shakes his head, grinning.

dialogue.content: A particular awful significance...
Which of you brave souls is willing bind this lovely young woman?

How often I've fought with my self over that night .. one half of me swearing bling that i tied a simple slip knot... the other half convinced that I tied the Langford double.	I suppose I'll never know for sure-

actions.content: Onstage, A SIMILAR TANK FILLED WITH WATER.
Julia stands next to the tank.	Milton adresses the audience.

Milton gestures to Julia- the crowd goes wild.	Julia makes a show of deciding.	She picks up Angier and Borden, who are made up to look different from the last performance.	Asthey leap up onto stage, Borden makes eye contact with Cutter in the wings- Cutter's is a WARNING GLANCE.As Angier ties Julia's ankles he can't resist tickling just under her toes- she KICKS him in the chin.Borden starts to wrap the rope around Julia's wrists in a particular fashion.	Stops.	Reconsiders.	Julia NODS at him, encouring.	Borden starts RETRYING the knot.Cutter watches.	His hand checking for the axe handle.Borden tests the rope- it is tight.	Julia gives him thesign with her eyes- he steps back.	Angier rises to his feet, grinning at Julia.	As she raises her arms to the hook, she can't quite hide her smile back at him.Milton gives the sign and Julia is HOISTED into the air. Cutter slips his STOPWATCH out of his pocket as Milton moes the tank under Julia's bare feet.Angier looks up at Julia.	Proud.	She stares out over the audience, preparing herself.	Looks down at Angier, smiling...Julia PLUNGES into the tank- Milton SLAMS the lid shut- Cutter checks his stopwatch, hand caressing the axe handle...Milton raises the curtain around the tank, then circles it, working his "magic".	Angier shifts a little.	Time passing... Milton looks at Cutter- TOO MUCH TIME...Cutter GRASPS his axe and SPRINT at the tank- Milton RIPS the curtain down- Julia, one arm free, is CONVULSING...Angier and Borden look on in HORROR as Cutter SWINGS his axe into the glass- which CRACKS... cutter SWINGS again and again- the web of crackes GROWING, Julia's convulsions SLOWING, her eyes PLEADING with Angier's, until-CRASH- the glass gives way, FLOODING the stage- Cutter and Angier GRASP at Julia- FULL her onto the stage- Cutter ELBOWS Angier out of the way to POUND on Julia's chest- Borden wacthes, stunned, as Julia FLOPS, LIFELESS, onto the boards. Cutter looks up at Angier, stricken.Angier takes Julia in his arms, looking down at her staring eyes.	He desperately BRUSHES water from Julias cheeks and forehead.	Borden looks on, shen.

dialogue.content: How can be not know?!
He must know what he did.	He must.

actions.content: Angier looks up from Borden's journal, despairing.
Angier FLINGS Borden's journal across the room.
Angier has his head SUBMERGED in a sink full of water.	He BURSTS FREE, GASPING- COLLA`PSES to the floor, SOBBING.
Angier lays out MAKE-UP SUPPLIES.	He takes out a BULLE. Places it on the sink next to a FALSE MOUNSTAGE.

dialogue.content: Get out your gun, Professor!
A volunteer.
Are you man enought, sir?
(quiet)
Yes.
(smiles)
I think not.

actions.content: Rough. Unwelcoming. Crowded. A small "stage" at one end: Borden works his way through the Chinese rings. The crowd is JEERING.
Someone BURLS a bottle at the stage- it narrowly misses. Borden GLARES out into the audience.	Pulls out his GUN.

The crowd SURGES forward with EAGER VOLUNTEERS.	Fallon scans the crowd, passing over too-eager and too-drunk before settling on a MOUNSTACHED MAN and bringing him up onstage.Borden LOADS the pistol, hands it to Moustache and steps backwards, pulling his coat apart, CHALLENGING.
Something in Moustache's tone makes Borden looks closely- behind the moustache... Angier.	QUIVERING WITH TENSION.Borden looks at the trembling gun.	Then at Angier.	Spreads his hands, inviting.

Angier purses his lips, straining to pull the trigger. INSERT CUT: JULIA'S FACE, SCREAMING BUBBLES...Angier's eyes are almost closed as he SQUEEZES the TRIGGER-Fallon HITS Angier JUMPS to Borden's side, GRABBING his BLEEDING HAND.	The DROWS is SCREAMING, PUSHING for the door,os STRAINING for a closer look at Borden. Aniger, SHOCKED, melts into the crowd.

scenes.heading: EXT. PRINCE'S ARMS BAR AND THEATRE

dialogue.content: Never thought I'd find an answer at the bottom of a pint glass.
Hasn't stopped you looking.
(Angier sits)
I heard about a booking.	Nice little theatre.	Good up-and-coming magician.
Who?
You.
You got me a booking? Why?
(looks up at Angier)
Because I want to keep working...And who's going to hire the ingeneur who killed Julia McCullough in front of a sellout crowd at the Orpheum?
Someone who know that it wasn't your fault.	Someone who knows Alfred Borden and his repertoire of exotic knots.
Heard he had a spot of bad luck doing a bullet catch South of the river.
To die like that.	Locked in water... lungs screaming...
(shakes head)
What did she go through, Cutter?
I knew an old sailor.	Told me about a time he got pulled over the side tangled in the sheets... they dragged him out, but it was five minutes before he coughed...
He said it was like... going home.
Which knot did Borden tie that night?
He wouldn't say.
Wouldn't say?!
It was as if... as if he didn't know.

actions.content: Angier sits at the bar.	Staring.	He raises his pint glass. Downs it, then STOPS, looking at the bottom- there is a PLAYING CARD.	He loos around. Cutter is sitting at a table with two fresh pints in front of him.	Angier heads over.
Cutter looks down into his beer.
Angier looks back at Cutter.
Angier looks down at the liquid in his glass.
Cutter watches Angier's distress.
Angier stares at Cutter.	Hanging.
Angier considers this.	Collects himself.

dialogue.content: We'll have to whitewash the windows to cofound the more curious members of your audience...
(looks around)
But this should do.We should see about an assistant.
I've made arrangements.	Have you settled on a name?
Yes, I have.	The Great Danton.
Hmm.	Bit old-fashioned?
No. It's sophisticated.

actions.content: Angier and Cutter isspect a large empty room.
Angier smiles gently at Cutter.

dialogue.content: What's so hard about this?
In here, Miss Wenscombe.	No point meeting Mr.Angier unless you fit.
Breathe as little as possible.Cutter closes the lid over her and walks over to Angier.
Not much experience , but she knows the basics.	She knows how to present herself and a pretty assistant's the most effective from of misdirection.
(smiles)
I suppose I should let her out.

actions.content: Angier is sitting at a worktable, pensive.	He is moving one hand across the other, making a ROSE appear and disappear.The windows have been WHITEWASHED and the room has filled with an array of magical apparati: cabinets, costumes, props.On the other side of the room Cutter watches as OLIVIA WENSCOMBE, 20s, equal parts grace and mischief, squeezes herself into a tall cabinet, looking past Cutter to Angier.
Cutter leans into the cabinet and pops up a TRICK PANEl in the floor, revealing a tiny chamber.
Olivia shrugs and hands Cutter her hat, then her thick skirts, and folds herself into the bottom of the box.
Angier nods.	There is a small SNEEZE from inside the cabinet.

dialogue.content: Nothing easy about two men sharing one life.

actions.content: Both Bordens are standing at the workbench. One brother is gripping the other by his wrist and placing a CHISEL on his finger.He checks the placemen of the chisel against his own mutilated fingers, adjust the chisel's position, them picks up the hammer.
The second brother SWIGS from a gin bottle, then BITES down a padded stick as the first brother BRINGS DOWN THE HAMMER-

dialogue.content: I don't understand, Alfred.	How can it be bleeding again?
What have you been doing to it?	It looks as had as the day it happened. We need to get the doctot back-
(snaps)
We can' afford the doctor back!
You've woken her.
I'm sorry.	I just need this to heal so I can het back to work.
Alfred, you have to face things. What tricks could you peform with this kind of injury?
(leans forward, excited)
Some of the card pulls, prop tricks...And the trick I've been telling you about.	The trick they'll remember me for.

actions.content: Sarah is frantcally REDRESSIN Borden's injured hand.	BLOOD has SEEPED trough the bandages.
She examines the wounds: 2 1/2 FINGERS ARE MISSING.	The injuries are black, but wet and fresh.
A BABY STARTS CRYING in the bedroom.	Sarah glares at Borden.
Sarah looks at Borden.	Reluctantly.

dialogue.content: The bird cage can't be our climax- everybody knows it.
Not like this, they don't.And I don't want to kill doves.
(snaps)(glares at Angier)
Then stay off the stage.You're a magician, not a wizard- you have to get your hands dirty to achieve the impossible.
You sound like him.
(holds up cage)
Put your hands on the sides...

actions.content: Angier and Cutter at the workbench, examine a BIRD CAGE. Cutter is wearing a strange LEATHER HARNESS over his shirt it has LARGE SPRINGS and small PULLEYS on the back.

dialogue.content: Hang on, hang on...
There we go.	Now you tell the volunteer to put his hands here...

actions.content: Now Angier is wearing the harness.	He places a dove in the cage and picks it up.Close on: HOOKS concealed on Angier's palm slip into CATCHES on the bars of the cage.
Cutter reaches in and slips a NOOSE around the bird's ankle...
Cutter pleases his hands on the TOP and BOTTOM of the cage...

dialogue.content: ...THREE!
Bloody marvelous, Cutter.
And the best part...
Thought you said I had to get my hands dirty.
Someday, perhaps you will.	I needed to know that you can.

actions.content: Angier and Cutter have their hands on the bird cage.
The bird cage BREAKS APART, WHIPPING UP ANGIER'S FOREARMS. WHERE SLEEVES WOULD BE, YANKED BY THE HARNESS.	Angier smiles.
Cutter reaches to Angier's armpit... pulls up the DOVE, HANGING BY ITS ANKLE, ALIVE.

dialogue.content: I need a volunteer.

actions.content: A heavy, disinterested man slouches in the third row of the empty theatre with a newspaper- MERRIT, the stage manager. Onstage, Angier energetically YANKS coloured handkerchiefs from a hat and TOSSING them into the air.	Olivia, in the glamorous, revealing costume of Magician's Assistant, darts back and forth PLUCKING the handkerchiefs from the air.Angier finishes with a flourish.	Merrit shrugs.	Angier places an ORNATE CAGE onto the table.
Merrit rolls his eyes.	Climbs to his feet.	Angier produces a DOVE.	Places it in the cage.

dialogue.content: You'd beat not be intending to hut this animal, Mr.Angier.
Of course not.
And one, two... THREE!

actions.content: Merrit places his hands on the TOP and BOTTOM of the bird cage.	Angier's hands are on the sides.	Olivia reaches around Merrit to place her hands on the remaining two sides.	Merrit looks up at Angier	over his glasses.
Angier raises and lowers their hands in a rythm... The bird cage, and the dove, VANISH.

dialogue.content: Very nice.	Very nice indeed.
(smiling)
I haven't had a chance to compliment you on your beautiful theatre yet, Mr.Merrit.
A lot more beautiful when it's full, Mr.Angier.
Don't worry.
You all say that. Why sould I worry? If your tricks don't get 'em in, someone else's will.	Maybe someone willing to do a bullet catch or a water scape.
cheap thrills, Mr.Merrit. People hoping for an accident- and quite likely to see one, too.	What would that do for your business?
(shrugs)
You've got a week.

actions.content: Merrit nods, impressed, stepping backwards.	Angier REACHES into Merrit's pocket.	Removes a dove.
Olivia packs up the props.	Cutter approaches from the wings.
A line a PATRONS runs from the box office to the street.The marquee above the theatre reads: "THE GREAT DANTON PERFOMS FEATS OF MISTERY AND IMAGINATION"

dialogue.content: You sir, in the hat.	Could you show us your handkerchief?
This isn't mine.
Perhaps you'd be so good as to return it to the other man.	He has yours.

actions.content: Angier is perfoming to a good crowd.  He steps forward.
A MAN in the audience STANDS and pulls a HANDKERCHIEF from his pocket.	He stares at it, CONFUSED.	The audience LAUGHS.
Another man stands and pulls out a handkerchief. APPLAUSE. Angier dows and walks quickly off the stage, past the squad of DANCING GIRLS who run on to entertain in the break.

dialogue.content: I'm so nervous- I'm sorry, I'm making mistakes.
The audience doesn't seem to be responding much, Cutter.
This is a grand theatre with a sophisticated audience-		They've seen most of these tricks before. But not this next one.	You'll see.
You!	Piss off out it!
Wish us luc, Cutter.
(smiling)
I'll have the champagne ready.

actions.content: Cutter and Olivia are waiting for Angier as he comes off.
Cutter quickly REMOVES Angier's coat...
Cutter puts he LEATHER HARNESS over Angier's arms...
Cutter checks the SPRINGS of the harness and replaces Angier's coat.	He spots a STAGEHAND poking his head around the flies.
The dancers are wrapping up.
Angier, followed by Olivia, steps out onto the stage.

dialogue.content: You've seen this one before?
Seen 'em all before, mate!
Well, I'll make it a little harder, shall I?
Two volunteers, please.	A lady and a gentleman to hold this cage with me...
I'll perform this feat in a manner never before seen by yourselves or by any other audience anywhere in the worth...
Any magician can make this cage disappear... that's why I'll ask this good lady and fine gentleman to place their hands firmly on the cage...
...to ensure that no trickery whatsover is employed.

actions.content: Angier steps to the table center stage.	Pulls out the bird cage.	There are one or two groans from the audience.	Angier SMILES as he produces a DOVE with a FLOURISH.
Laughter.
In the wings, Cutter smiles and nods at Angier's showmanship.
Hands go up.	Olivia pulls an ELEGANT LADY from the audience.
Olivi brings Elegant Lady onto the stage along with a RED- BEARDED MAN.	The audience is getting interested.	Angier is on role...
Olivia guides Elegant Lady's hands onto the sides of the cage.	Red-beard places a hand underneath the cage.

Angier RAISES the bird cage.	The audience is RAPT.Red beard's other hand appears on the top of the cage- it is MUTILATED, missing fingers.Angier FREEZES- looks up at Red Beard... IT IS BORDENBorden SMILES as he WORMS his little finger into the cage mechanism...SNAP!	HALP THE CAGE WHIPS UP ANGIER'S SLEEVE- THE OTHER HALF COLLAPSES ON THE DOVE AND THE ELEGANT LADY'S FINGERS- SHE SCREAMS- BIRD BLOOD SPLATTERS ONTO THE THREE OF THEN- THE AUDIENCE GOES CRAZY-Borden smiles at Angier through his blood-spattered fake beard and retreats into the chaos surrounding the Elefant Lady who is still SCREAMING as Angier tries to free her fingers from the mechanism.

dialogue.content: I should've spotted him.
You had a lot of plates spinning.
Don't suppose they'll let us do this one again.
No.
So what's the climax of our show?
Show?	You don't have a show.
Mr.Merrit, we have a week's engagment-
To perform magic- not butcher birds and break my costomer's fingers!Clear out, anything here in the morning gets burned.
Mr.Merrit-
It's done, John.	I've hired a comedian.	You know I hate comedians, which should indicate the may I felel about your friend's future as a stage magician.
There are plenty of good theatres... if we can come up with another trick and change the name of the act-
The name stays.
Right.	Well, the new trick will have to be irresistible, then.	I've a couple of methods to try out, but we'll need a fresh angle on the presentation.
If you need inspiration, there's a technical exposition at the Albert Hall this week.	Scientists and engineers.	That sort of thing captures the popular imagination.

actions.content: Angier and Cutter watch the STAGEHANDS clear the stage.
Angier looks down at the harness in his hands.
Cutter puts his hand on Merrit's arms.
Cutter nods.	Merrit leaves.	Cutter turns to Angier.
Cutter sees Angier's resolve.
Angier nods.
The large concert hall is surrounded by crowds and covered in banners advertising a Technical Exposition.	Angier makes his way past a giant STEAM ENGINE and into the building.

dialogue.content: Would you like to know the future, sir? The man who kill change the world is speaking right now.Continents divided no more.	Free, clean power. The mysteries of the world solved.

actions.content: THe lobby if filled with displays and models.	Angiers pokes around, looking thouroughly disinterested until he comes to an information booth plastered with illustrations of electrical bolts.
The posters show a tall, handsome man bathed in lightning and standing astride the world like colossus.	In bold print it says:THE WONDERS OF "ALTERNATING CURRENT"...NIKOLA TESLA

dialogue.content: With a system like this I could have the entire city electrified whitin two years.
Mr. Edison's direct current system is flawed and dangerous.	With my alternating current devices-
(yells)
Fraud.

actions.content: The hall is completely darkened, but bright blue FLASHES illuminate ANGIER as he pushes his way to a seat.On the stage, a tall rod capped with a steel ball is transmitting a steady, sparking stream of electricity onto a matched ball across the stage.A FIGURE walks around from behind the machine and the audience GASPS as a shower of sparks bounce off of his immaculate evening wear.	This is TESLA- but Angier is too far from the stage to get a good look at him.
The audience breaks into LAUGHTER.	The spell is broken. Tesla must be a lunatic.
Someone from the audience chimes in:

Angier turns to look.	The man who called out is leaving he's not alone.	Angier FREEZES, staring down at aisle-Borden is sitting there, RAPT, lit by FLASHES from the machinery on stage.	As tesla continues his demonstration, Angier STARES at Borden.

dialogue.content: I love you.
See?	Today, it's true.
I saw hapiness...

actions.content: Borden walks down the street.	Angier is following him. Borden meets Sarah, pushing a PRAM.	Borden looks down at the baby then up at Sarah.
Sarah smiles.
Angier watches Borden kiss wife then his baby.

dialogue.content: (embarrassed)
I thought you'd gone.
I don't really.... have anywhere to go.
You've been sleeping here?
Cutter said it would be okay till we get another booking.
(beat)
What are you doing?
Researching.	Part of a magician's job is to watch his competition, to see what illusions they're-
You're going to do something to that man, aren't you?
Cutter's hopig you'll let thingslife.	He says if Borden thinks things are even between you then we can-
Even? My wife for a couple of his fingers? He has a child now. And he's perfoming again.
(bitter)
Borden is out there, living his life just as he always intended.	As if nothing had happened.	And look at me.	I'm alone.	And no theatre will touch me.
Us.
You're going to need a better disguise.

actions.content: A NEWSPAPER on the makeup table.	Angier sits at the mirror.He hubs BROWN PASTE into his hair and then combs it out. Then he chooses a beard, seats it on his chin and begins to adjust it.	He drops the BOTTLE of spirit gum as he looks in the mirror and sees OLIVIA standing behind him.
Olivia shifts.	Embarrassed.
Angier slips the newspaper from the table.
Olivia moves closer.	Angier is quiet.
Olivia moves towards him.
Olivia reaches for Angier's beard.

dialogue.content: I need a volunteer.
As you can see , it's just a rubber ball.	But it's not normal at all.
Thank you.
(to audience)
You're not impressed?
It's a magic ball.
What happened?

actions.content: Angier, almost unrecognizanle as a blonde, slips into the back of the theatre, which is as rough and unwelcoming as Borden's last venue. On the small raised stage, Borden works through his way through the Chinese rings with GLOVED HANDS to hide his damaged fingers.	The tough crowd is JEERING AT HIM.Borden puts the rings down on a table and PICKS UP a bag.
Angier takes a few steps towards the stage. Borden produces a RUBBER BALL.he TOSSES the ball to Angier.
Angier examines the ball.	Hands it back to Borden who shows no sign of recognizing Angier.
Angier notices that two TALL BLACK CABINETS are standing twenty feet apart on the stage.
Borden BOUNCES the BALL on the ground and catches it.
Borden continues to BOUNCE the ball on the floor.	The audience looks bored, waiting for something to happen.

dialogue.content: It was the greatest magic trick I have ever seen.

actions.content: Now it's CUTTER standing in the audience, watching.	Onstage, Borden BOUNCES the ball over and over again.

Borden walks to one side of the stage and OPENS the door to one of the cabinets.	It's empty.	He CLOSES it again and crosses the stage, BOUNCING the ball the whole way.At the far cabinet, Borden repeats the process, OPENING the door to the empty cabinet.	This time, however, he leaves the door open.He steps forwards and GENTLY BOUNCES the ball SIDEWAYS, across the stage...Borden STEPS into the CABINET behind him, CLOSING the door.With no one on stage, the audience watches as the ball continues to BOUNCE across the stage. BOUNCE. BOUNCE. BOUNCE.  The ball loses seep and height...Just as reaches the second cabinet, something IMPOSSIBLE happens.THE DOOR TO THE SECOND CABINET OPENS AND BORDEN STEPS OUT, CATCHING THE BALL.Cutter FLINCHES, then studies Borden.	The audience is BEMUSED.	Finally, a trickle of applause.

dialogue.content: -or the one who come back out?

actions.content: As the ball bounces acroos the stage, Borden steps into the cabinet, shutting the door behind him.
Borden steps out of the second cabinet and catches the ball.

dialogue.content: We took turns.	The trick is where we would swap...

actions.content: A stagehand wheels the two stage cabinets into the dressing room and leaves.	Borden holts the door after him.
Borden opens the first cabinet and pulls up the false bottom. His TWIN BROTHER, in indentical stage clothes, uncurls himself from the hidden compartment and hauls himself out.
Fallon and Borden are seated at the makeup table.	Fallon begins removing pieces of his costume and makeup and handing them to the other brother.	As we watch,	THEY SWITHC INDENTITIES.

Angier is disguise, starts CLAPPING loudly, FIRMLY, as if he can't help it, LEADING the applause.Borden BOUNCES the ball once again, then BOWS deeply.	The APPLAUSE peters out.	Borden walks off the stage.

dialogue.content: What happened, Robert?
He had a new trick.
Was it good?

actions.content: Angier still in disguise, is slumped in an armchair, drink in hand.	He is SMILING, remembering.Olivia, sitting on the workbench, waits for him to continue.
Angier looks at her...

dialogue.content: Did they applaud when you saw it?
Not very enthusiastically.

actions.content: Angier is talking to Cutter.	Olivia is watching.

dialogue.content: The trick is too good -- too simple- the audience harly knows what they've seen.
He's a dreadful magician.
He's a wonderfull magician- he's a dreadful showman.	He doesn't know how to dress it up, how to sell the trick.
How does he do it?
He uses a double.
(shakes head)
It's not that simple.	This is a complex illusion.
You think that because you don't know the method.	It's a double who comes out at the end.	It's the only way.
I've seen his perfom ir three times now, Mr. Cutter- the Prestige is the same man-It's not-
ANGIERThe same man comes out of the second cabinet.	I promise you.
It is the same man.
He wears padded gloves to hide his damaged fingers, but if you look closely you can tell.
He doesn't know how to sell his trick to an audience.	But I do.
(nods)
It would give us our climax.
The man stole my life.	I'm going to steal his trick.
We'll have to find someone who can look like you on a stage.
He doesn't use a double-
(impacient)
I don't know how Borden does it, Robert.	So either you wait for Borden to retire and buy his secret, or you can listen to how I would do this trick.
(Angier nods)
Ang the only way I know is to find you a bloody good double.
Take a good look-	let's get out there and find me.

actions.content: Angier turns to Cutter.
They both turn to look at Olivia.
Angier looks at Cutter.
Angier smiles.	Turns to Olivia, pointing to his face.

dialogue.content: (to tramp)
Gerry?
Mr. Angier, Mr. Cutter, I would like you	to meet Mr. Gerald Root.
A pleasure to meet you fine gentlemen.
(whisper)
Would you like for me to tell you a little joke?
(yelling)
Are you laughing?
He's out of his mind.
He's an out-of-work actor- of course he's out of his mind.
He's perfect. A little work, mind you, but when I'm done with him he could be your brother.
I don't need him to be my brother. I need him to be me.

actions.content: The club is warm and dark. Olivia, Cutter and Angier make their way to the bar.	Olivia points to the far end of the bar, to a TRAMP in tattered clothing, curled over a pint.

The tramp sees Olivia, hoists himself up and spills his way down the bar to them.	As he draws closer, we understand why Olivia has brought them here.Underneath the filth and matted hair, this man is SPITTING IMAGE of Robert Angier- HE IS PLAYED BY THE SAME ACTOR
Angier is staring a little too much.	Root throws an ARM over Angier's shoulder and draws him in.
Angier smiles unconfortably.	Sunddely Root WRAPS this hands around Angier's neck and begins to THROTTLE him.Cutter breaks it up and pushes Root back.
Angier is shaken.	Root picks up his hat off the bar and disappears onto the street.

scenes.heading: INT. GREEN ROOM DRINKING CLUB -- EVENING

dialogue.content: Would you like to see a magic trick?
What is this for?
When I asked last week you said we couldn't afford.
You caught me in the wrong mood.
But you want through all the-
Sarah,	I'm allowed to change my mind, aren't I? The act is taking off, maybe soon I'll get us into a bigger theatre.	Things will work.

actions.content: Borden escorts Sarah and their TODDLER, a girl, up the three lined street.Borden stops abruptly.	Crouches to his daugther.
Borden reaches up and pushes a wayward LOCK a her hair over her ear.	When his hands returns, it's holding a KEY.He stands, places the key in Sarah's hand.
Borden takes her gently by the shoulders and turns her around until she's facing a modest two-story HOUSE.	She looks down at the key in her hand.
Sarah turns and embraces her husband.

dialogue.content: You walk through this one- then...?

actions.content: The auditoruim is empty.	Two doors is simple frames have been erected in the middle of the stage.	Angier fiddles with one, opening it, walking through it.	Olivia is watching.
Angier stands Olivia in front of the door.he pushes the door all way open.	Suddenly, a TRAP-DOOR set into the floor POPS open. Angier JUMPS through it-
Olivia gathers up her skirts and DROPS through the hole-

dialogue.content: Oof.	Couldn't you find a softer one?
(smiles)
It's not for sleeping on.
And Root goes up through there?
It's going to be amazing, Robert.
It has to be.	Borden's trick is getting noticed.	The place was packed today.
You went and saw his show again?
You becoming obsessed, Robert.
Ready to meet yourself, Mr. Robert.

actions.content: -LANDING beside Angier on the straw matterss.
Olivia looks around the below stage area.
She gestures	at a LIFT twenty feet away with a TRAP DOOR MECHANISM above it.	Angier nods.	Olivia looks at Angier.
Olivia looks at him strangely.
Angier looks away, embarrassed.
Angier and Olivia look up to see Cutter at the trap door.

scenes.heading: INT. BENEATH THE EMPIRE STAGE -- CONTINUOUS

dialogue.content: All I have to do is keep myself stinking drunk all the time and no one will be able to tell the difference.
A little faith, sir.	Could you favor us with a perfomance. Mr. Root?
You would drink, too, if you know the world half so well as I do.
Did you think you were unique, Mr. Angier?	I have been Cassar.	I have been Faust.	How difficult could it possibly be to play 'The Great Danton?'
You can go back to being yourself. Root.	For free..
I'd rather be him, for now.	I find it amusing.
Root has to keep a low profile-- anyone sees him the game's up.
(watching Root)
I don't know how you do these things, Cutter.	I'm not sure I want to know.
Have you thought about what we should call the trick?
No point being coy.	Borden calls his trick 'The Transported Man'?

actions.content: Angier and Olivia sit in the front row.	Cutter beckons Root onstage.	He's been clened up and dressed in Angier's stage costume.	he TRIPS on his way across the stage.

Root picks himself up and dusts himself off. Suddenly, ROOT HAS BECOME ANGIER.	he is channeling everything from his facial expressions to his walk.	Angier nods,starting to believe this might work.	The illusion is PERFECT -- till he opens his mouth.
Angier hops up onto stage, examining Root from different angles.	Root starts APING his every movement.	Olivia starts laughing.	Angier is getting uncomfortable.
Root looks challengingly at both men.
Root WAVES his hands across his chest, in the same manner that Angier does onstage.	He produces a bottle of Gin from thin air, and takes a long swallow and jumps down to Olivia.
Cutter nods.
The enormous MARQUEE of the Empire Theatre:'The Great Danton perfoms THE NEW TRANSPORTED MAN'Beneath it, a CROWD.	Fallon amongest them.	STARING up at the sign.

dialogue.content: Ladies and gentlemen, much of what you've seen tonight can be termed illusions.	Entertaining trifles of the sort you may have seen other magicians perform.

Alas, I cannot claim this next feat as illusion.	Watch carefully- you will see no trickery, for no trickery is being employed. Merely a techique familiar to certain citizens of the orient and various holy men of the Himalyas.	Indeed, some of you maybe familiar with this technique, but for those of you who aren't, do not be alarmed, what you are about to see is considered safe...

actions.content: Angier is onstage, nearing the end of his show, SMILING BROADLY as he pulls dozens of FLOWERS from thin air and tosses them to the crowd.	APPLAUSE fills the theatre.The DOORFRAMES are wheeld out on either side of the stage. Angier approaches the edge of the stage to address the audience with a suddenly SOLEMN demeanor.
Angier puts on a TOP HAT.

Angier gracefully TURNS and heads upstage to the right-hand door, opens it, SLAPS it to show that is sold.Then strolls through crossing the stage--to the other door, which he opens, SLAPPING to show its solidity, then walking trough the frame.Angier removes his TOP HAT and THROWS it high into the air. It sails back down to him and he catches it.Angier THROWS the HAT again, even harder this time, and it disappears uo into the rafters. After a beat, it is clear it's not coming back down.LAUGHTER.	Angier snaps his fingers and the hat is dropped back down to him.	He catches it.Angier movies to the first door and THROWS HIS HAT in a HIGH ARC across the stage.	He OPENS the door- steps behind it...The second DOOR, FAR ACROSS THE STAGE, IMMEDIATELY opens and ANGIER/ROOT EMERGES, REACHING UP TO CATCH THE HAT.BOTH DOORS SLAMS SHUT behind him.  He puts on the hat.The AUDIENCE ERUPTS- A STANDING OVATION, Fallon the only one in his seat as Angier/Root takes his BOWS.
Angier, hearing the MASSIVE APPLAUSE, climbs off the straw mattress, PEERING up through the cracks in the floorboards.Smiling, Angier turns to the unseen audience and BOWS.

dialogue.content: (toast)
To our achivement.
The manager said he's never seen a reaction like it.
At least he got to see it.	I spent the ovation hidden under the stage. No one cares about the man who disappears, the man who goes into the box.	They care about the man who comes out the other side.
I care about the man in the box. Angier turns to Olivia, raises his glass.
Thank you.
(to Cutter)
Maybe we could switch before the trick.	That way I could be the Prestige and Root ends up below stage.
(shakes head)
The antecipation of the trick is everything- it needs your showmanship to built suspense.	If Root openshis mouth, it's all over- he can't introduce the trick.
of course I can.	I'm the Great Danton.
Root, you bloody fool, get that costume and makeup off right now, anyone could walk in here!
Congratulation, all.
I suppose I should get more rest.
Life is not full of these moments, Robbie.
We've worked hard for this, and we need to celebrate properly.
What's wrong?
It is your wife?
The trick isn't good enough.
Didn't you see the audience?
No.
Well, they loved it.
It's not as good as his trick.
Borden's trick is nothing compared to ours.	He doesn't have any style-
He doesn't have to spend the finale hiding under the stage.
I need to know how he does it.
Why?
So that I can do it better.
I need you to go and work for him.
Work for him?	Are you joking
You'll be my spy.
(taken aback)
We just got our start and you want me to leave?
It's how we advance.
Think of it, Olivia... we've got people excited about Cutter's version of the trick- imagine what we could do with the real illusion. We'llhave the greatest magic act anyone's ever seen.
(frustated)
He knows I work for you.
Exactly why he'll want to hire you. He'll want my secrets.
Why would he trust me?
Because you're going to tell him the truth.

actions.content: Angier, Olivia, and Cutter are CELEBRATING their sucess. Empty bottles of champagne line the makeup table.
They drink.
Angier smiles, rueful.
They turn.	Root is lying behind a trunk, still in costume.
Cutter is SLAPPING Root to his feet.	He grabs his collar and turns to Angier and Olivia.
Cutter DRAGS Root out.	Olivia slides onto the makeup table.
Olivia pours him some more champagne.
Angier looks up at her with a gentle smile.	She pulls him in closer and they KISS.	She wraps her legs around him.They kiss again. Angier pulls back.
Angier shakes his head, distracted.
Olivia stares at him.
Angier rises, turning out of her embrace.
Angier turns to her.	Looks her in the eye.
Angier moves to Olivia, placing his hands on her shoulders.
Angier thinks for a second.	Then smiles.

dialogue.content: (looking around)
Interesting workshop.
We make do.
My name is Olivia Wenscombe.
I know who you are.	Are you here to steal the rest of my show?
No.	I'm here to give your show what is missing.
And what might that be?
Me.
(to Fallon)
Wasn't I just saying that, Bernard? A woman's touch.
I've left Angier.	I want a job.
I know you have no reason to trust me-
Why on earth shouldn't I trust you? The mistress of my enemy.
Mr.Borden- Alfred.
OLIVIAAlfred.	I'm going to tell you the truth.
Ah.	The truth.	A slippery notion in our life of work, Miss Wenscombe.
I'm here because he sent me here.He wants me to come and work for you and steal your secret.
What does he need my secret for? His trick is top notch.	The Great Danton vanishes and isntantly reappears on the other side of the stage --	mute, overweight, and, unless I'm mistaken, rather drunk.
Tell me, Olivia.	Does he like taking his bows under the stage?

No.	It's killing him.	he's obsessed with discovering your method.	He thinks of nothing else, and takes no pleasure in our sucess.		I've had enough.	There's no future with him. He sent me here to steal your secrets, but I've actually come to offer you his.
He has no secrets from me.
And this is the truth?

actions.content: A small, disused shop off an arcade, crowed with tools, cabinetry and props, windows plastered with playbills.	Borden is sitting at a workbench, sleeves rolled up, working a lathe.Fallon enters, Olivia behind him.	Borden looks back at her, turns back to the table, instinctively putting on his gloves.
Olivia sees one of the theatrical notices that litter the shop: "THE GREAT DANTON BREAKS RECORD WITH HIS ASTONISHING NEW TRICK"
Fallon leaves, closing the door.
Borden sits there.
Olivia is taken aback.	Chanes tack.
Borden rises, moves closer to Olivia.
Olivia meets his gaze.
Borden stares at her, unsure.
She gives Borden a challenging smile/shrug.

dialogue.content: His assistent come to us with a proposition...
Obviously Angier has sent her, and told her to admit as much...
Tell me Olivia.	Does he like taking his bows under the stage?

No.	It's killing him.	He's obssessed with discovering your method.	he thinks of nothing else, and takes no pleasure in our success.	I've had enough.	There is no future withhim.	He sent me here to steal your secrets, but I've actually come to offer you his.
He has no secrets from me.
This is the "truth" you spoke of?
No. This is what he told me to tell you.
The truth is that I loved him.	And stood by him.	And he sent me to you like he'd send a stagehand to pick up his shirts.
(looks him in the eye)
I hate him for that.
I can spot Angier's methods from the back of the theatre. What could you possibly have to offer me?
You may know he does his tricks... but you can't understand why no one can see that yours are better.
You hide this.	I had to look closely to spot it when you performed the Transported Man.
(looks into his eyes)
But this makes you unique... it shows the audience that you aren't using a double;	You musn't hide it, you
(looks at hand)
must display it proudly...I'm sure it takes great skill to perform illusions with one good hand.
(quietly)
It does.
Then let people know.	You can be so much more then he is.	I can show you how.
I think she is telling the truth.

actions.content: Borden turns to see Fallon show in Olivia.
They start to speak as Borden's V.O. continues.
Olivia meets his gaze.
Borden stares at her, unsure.
She gives him a sly smile.Beat.
They sit there in silence, appraising each other.
Olivia smiles, moves to Borden, reaching for his gloved hand. Borden flinches, surprised.
She tenderly PEELS OFF his padded glove revealing his mutiladed hand.
Borden looks into her eyes.

dialogue.content: I think we cannot trust her.	But I love her.	I need her.	We need her.
How could he send you away?	He must be blind, deaf and dumb.
Robbie's blinded by his jealosy. He'd do anything for you secret. Sending me away was the least of it.
Trust is not the point- love is the point... who have we ever trusted?To open myself to such a relationship,

actions.content: Borden and Olivia are in bed together.	It is raining outside.He watching her get out of bed and moves to the window to smoke a cigarette.
She smiles quietly at this.
Borden considers this.

dialogue.content: ...to the dangers of such an affair... I need assurances of fidelity.	Of love.
But how to be sure when truth is layered like the skin of an onion?I know a way... she must help me rid ourselves of Angier. It is the only way to kow her mind.

actions.content: Olivia makes her way past crowed MARKET STALLS.
Fallon is SHADOWING her from a distance.

dialogue.content: ...and his account suggests a reason.
To what do I owe the pleasure of this rather welcome pint of ale?
You are the Great Danton, aren't you?
Of course I am.	But don't advertise it- I'll be mobbed with fans.
(grins at Borden)
And who might you be?
Just a humble admirer.	And fellow practitioner.
Ah, very good.
Another?
If you insist.	I'm not perfoming tonight.	Well, only one show, and, to be frank, my people pretty much run things these days.
You could probably do it blindfolded.
Bloody good idea.
Have it.
Thanks.
Actually, there's something I might warn you about.
Oh?
Well, it's your Transported Man illusion.	Now, I'm noit claiming to know your method... but I had a similar trick in my act- and I used...
(looks around, whispering)
...a double.
Oh, I see, very good.
At first.	Then it went bad.	You se,	I hadn't counted on the fact that once I incorporated this bloke into my act, he had complete power over me.
Complete power, you say?
(nodding gravely)
Weel, he was the secret, you see. And the more successful I became, the more outrageous his demands became.	He practically backrupted me.	In the end I had to stop performing the illusion completely.
(looks at Root)
You must be very careful about giving someone that power over you.
Thanks for the warning.

actions.content: The bar is dark and seedy, packed with an unpromising lot.

Root is hanging precariously from his barstool, head lolling towards his empty glass.	He is in his own clothes, but cleaned up to look like Angier.A full PINT arrives in front of him. Root turns to face his benefactor- BORDEN. Root takes several large GULPS, staring at Borden.  Suppresses a belch.
Root gestures silence, glancing around them.
Root DOWNS the rest of his new pint, placing the empty glass in front of Borden with an emphatic THUNK.
A new pint arrives.	Root sips.
Root looks at Borden.	Drunken whells spinning.

dialogue.content: Best be getting changed for the martinee, sir.
(sniffs)
ROOT!	You're late.And even more drunk than usual.	Get yourself below stairs, right away!
No.
No?!
We need to have a chat, Mr.Cutter.

actions.content: Cutter is fixing a prop mechanism.	Angier approaches, in his undershirt, looks over his shoulder.	Cutter glances up.
- Angier nods.	Cutter REALIZES.
Root looks at Cutter with genuine malice.

dialogue.content: We have a problem, Cutter.
He'll be perfoming right across the street.
We have a bigger problem.	Root.
Don't tell me he fell over again.
Worse.	He realized he can make demands.
He's blackmailing us?
In a word, yes. I'm surprised, to be honest- it usually takes them a lot longer to figure it out.
How much does he want?
It makes no difference- we have to stop doing the trick.
(wields paper)
Stop doing the trick?	Look at this.
Look at yesterday's.	And last week's, where they called you "London's premiere stage performer", not "magician" mind.	Performer.	Of any kind.
What's the point?
My point, Robert, is that you've climbed too high to get away with any kind of professional embarrassament.	We're not doing any tricks we can't control.
Pay him whatever he wants, for now. We keep doing the trick till Borden opens, then we'll phase it out.

Alley FIRES a GENERATOR connected by thick cables to the machine. It RUMBLES into life, smoke pouring from the slats.
