Without further ceremony, Alley FIRES the machine.Nothing happens.	Then, as they watch, the GLOBE on top of the tripped FLASHES whits hot.	BOLTS shooting out of it,wrapping themselves around the legs of the tripod.	The CHARGE reaches a FREEZY and then emits a loud BANG, as if it has broken the sound barrier.Suddenly the room is still.Tesla walks forward.	Looks down into the pit.Alley joins him at the edge of the pit.	Angier,	limping, is the last to arrive, locking into the pit--at the TOP HAT, which hasn't moved an inch.
Tesla STARES at the hat as if trying to melt it with CONCENTRARION.	Alley pulls Angier away from the pit.
Angier begins to protest but Alley gestures towards the door.

dialogue.content: We paid him enough to keep him in beer- you wouldn't expect him to rock the boat.	Today I learned Borden's view on the episode...

actions.content: Angier sits with Borden's dairy.

scenes.heading: INT. RESTAURANT, CLIFF HOUSE INN -- DAY

actions.content: Angier walks up to the hotel.	A MOTORCAR is parked in front and TWO MEN are unloading it.	One of the men STARES at Angier as he enters the hotel.

dialogue.content: I thought I had the place to myself.
Unexpected guests.
(looks out the window at the men)
Not very polite.	A lot of questions. At first I thought they might work for the government.
No?
(lowers voice)
Worse.	They work for Thomas Edison.

actions.content: Angier walks to the reception desk.
Angier starts out the windo at the men unloading equipment.

dialogue.content: Today, a most curious development...

actions.content: Angier sits at the desk, deciphering Borden's diary.

dialogue.content: Today my mistress proves her truthfulness. Not to me, you understand.
I have been convinced since she led me to Root... today, Olivia proves her love	for me to you, Angier.

Yes, Angier.	She gave you this noteboook at my request.	Yes, she led me to Root, and yes, Tesla is merely the key to my dairy, not to my trick. Did you really think I would part with my secret so easily after so much?	Good-bye, Angier, may you find solace for your thwarted ambition back in yout American home.

actions.content: Angier looks up from Borden's diary.	Pale. He flips pages and pages forward TO THE LAST ENTRY...
Angier looks up from the notebook.	Mind reeling.
Angier STARES at the pages, unblinking.	JUMPS to his feet...

dialogue.content: TESLA!
(nothing)
TESLA!!
ALLEY, GET OUT HERE AND LET ME IN!!

actions.content: Angier STRIDES up to the fence.
Angier takes his cane and starts running its METAL TIP across the eletrified fence- causing SPARKING and CRACKLING.
Alley emerges from the building, consufed.

dialogue.content: I've veen played for a fool!
Who by?
Tesla never made a machine like the one I asked for.
We never said he had.
You let me believe that he had, Alley!
You stole my money because your funding	was cut off- you've been shooting sparks at my top hat, laughing at me all along while you use my money to stave off ruin.I've	seen Edison's men-
Where?
In the hotel.	I've every mind to bring them up here myself-
That would be unwise, Mr.Angier.
It is true, sir, that you are your one remaining financier.	But we have not stolen your money...
Sir, my cat?

When I told you I could make your machine I spoke the simple truth. Science is just a name for the art of rendering the exotic mundane.	It has no boundaries- its very purpose is to destroy boundaries.
Then why isn't the machine working?
Because exact science, Mr.Angier, is not an exact science.	The machine simply does not operate as expected. It needs continued examination.
Where did my top hat go?
Nowhere.
We've tried the damn thing a dozen times.	And the hat went nowhere.
Which is why we need to rey a different material.	It may provoke a different result.
You don't expect me to handle the thing myself?
You are responsible for whatever happens to this animal, Doctor.
I'll go.

actions.content: Alley opens the door-	Angier BURSTS IN past him, ENRAGED.
Tesla is holding a cage containing a large tabby CAT.
Tesla silences Alley with a tiny GLANCE.
Tesla gives Angier the slightest of smiles.
Alley points to the top hat, which is sitting on a workbench.
Tesla opens the cage and points the open end at Alley.
Alley reluctantly reaches into the cage and pulls out the TERRIFIED CAT.	He jumps down into the pit and secures the animal bu its collar to a eye-hook sunk into the ground.

Alley pulls himself out of the pit, and Tesla CHARGES the generator.The cat stares up at the machine around it and HISSES.Without ceremony, Tesla FIRES the machine.	As before, large BOLTS spew from the head of the machine, down towards the unseen cat.	The machine build to a DEAFENING ROAR, then sputters out.Silence.	The three men begin edging towards the pit.Suddenly, a terrifying SCREECH.	The cat is still there, still tied to the hook.Alley breathes a sigh of relief and starts to free the car. Tesla looks frustated.	Suddenly, the cat bursts free of Alley and ROCJETS through the open side door of the lab.
Angier limps after the cat.
Angier sees the cat disappearing along the edge of the building and into the forest beyond.Angier follows.

dialogue.content: Here, kitty, kitty.

actions.content: Angier pushes his way through the dense undergrowth, trying to keep up, but the cat has disappeared.

Suddenly, a HORRIBLE SCREECHING reaches Angier.	He begins to follow the noise.He stops at the opening of a tiny GLADE, no more than ten feet across.Two IDENTICAL CATS are fighting viciously in front of Angier. He tries to separate the two animals, and succeeds in grabbing one.	The other cat RACES off.Angier takes a few steps after it, then FREEZES, staring at-TOP HATS.	Clustered in a small glads.	The first cat slinks its way through them.The SECOND BLACK cat jumps from Angier's hands- RACES into the glade, HISSING, SPITTING, CHASING the first cat into the woods beyond-Angier is left alone in the clearing, staring at the pile of dozens of IDENTICAL TOP HATS.

dialogue.content: So the machine was working?
I never bothered to check the calibration.	The hat never moved.
These things never quite work as you expect them to, Mr. Angier.	That's one of the principal beauties of science.
We'll need a couple of weeks to iron out the-
(looks at hats)
-problems with the machine.	I'll send word when it's ready.
Don't forget your hat.
Which one is mine?
They are all your hat, Mr. Angier.

actions.content: The top hats are in a pile on the dark.	Tesla is at the table, measuring two HATS with a pair of Calipers.	Angier and Alley are watching.
Tesla looks carefully at the hat in his hands.	It has a tiny TEAR on the inside of the brim.	He picks up another hat.	It has the same TEAR.
Angier, still dazed, takes his cane and heads for the door.
Angier stops and looks at the pile of hats.
Tesla smiles at him.

dialogue.content: ...you want to be fooled.

actions.content: A cat slinks its way through a pile of top harts, knocking one over as it disappears into the forest beyond.
We are left alone in the glade, staring at the top hats- FADE OUT.CREDITS. END.

dialogue.content: Are you watching closely?

actions.content: T	H	E	P	R	E	S	T	I	G	E.TOP HATS.	Clustered in a small glade.	As we SUPER TITLES,a BLACK CAT slinks its way through them.	As TITLES END-
A SECOND BLACK CAT races into frame, HISSING, SPITTING,CHASING the first cat into the woods beyond and we-

dialogue.content: But I seem to have outstayed my welcome in Colorado.
The extraordinary is not permitted in science and industry.	Perhaps you'll have more luck in your field, mystified.	As to the use of the machine...

actions.content: Under cover of night, a group of FIGURES ransack the laboratory.
The figure begin setting FIRE to the sides of the laboratory.

dialogue.content: -Destroy it.	Drop it to the bottom of the deepest ocean.
Such thing will only bring you misery.

actions.content: Alley holds open the door to a coach.  Tesla steps up intoit and looks back from the coach's open door, up the mountain.
High on the mountain, the laboratory is ABLAZE.
Tesla folds himself into the coach, shutting the door as it moes off down the mountain.

dialogue.content: Are we going to the zoo this afternoon, daddy?
Daddy's got some business this afternoon.
But you promised.
Did I?
Then go to the zoo we shall.
(gestures to newspaper)
Who's that?
That's you, daddy?
Daddy has some errands to run.	I'll be back before you know it, so get ready.
We each have our vices.
Sarah.	Whatever you may think, your only competitions for my affections is my little girl.	I love you.	I will always love you, and you alone.
You mean it today.
Absolutely.
That makes it so much harder when you don't.

actions.content: Borden's daughter, JESS, now four, runs into the room and tries to hop up into his lap.	Laughing, he helps her up.
Jess nods at him, solemly.
Borden holds the newspaper open for her to look at.
A large advertisement features a picture of Borden: The Professor- England's premiere magician!
Borden picks up the girl off of his lap and stands.

Borden walks to the door.	As he does, Sarah enters, avoiding his eyes, then ducking him as he tries to kiss her.She reaches for the sherry decanter.	He watches her pour. Sarah looks at him, eyes red from crying.
Borden moves to her, gentle concern in his eyes.
She looks into his eyes.	Fascinated.
She turns from him.	Borden watches her sadly.	Leaves.

dialogue.content: More shopping.	She doesn't like the smell of money, doesn't she?
The little lady wants to visit the Zoo, I thought you could take her. I'll do it tomorrow, if not.
(looks at his feet)
Sarah... she knows.	At least, she knows things aren't right.
(looks at Fallon, pleading)
Help me with her.	Try and convince her that I love her.	Please.

actions.content: Borden walks along a disused strecth of industrial canal that snakes through the poorer neighborhoods of the city. Borden wanders into a tunel.	Another man is waiting for him -- Fallon.Fallon hands Borden a folded piece of paper.	He studies it.
Fallon looks away.	Borden tears up the paper.
Borden, embarrassed, pats Fallon on the shoulder and makesoff down the path.	Fallon sets off in the opposite direction.

dialogue.content: What is it. Freddy?
Please don't call me that.	It's nothing, just... sometimes things seem... wrong.
Freddy, I've told you before.	When you're with me, you're with me.Leave your family at home where they belong.
I'm trying, Olivia.	Please.
I'll get dressed.
I saw Fallon hanging around my house again, after you left.
There's something about him I don't trust.
You trust me?
(off her look)
Then trust Fallon- he protects the things I care about.

actions.content: Olivia, barely wearing a dressing gown, answers the door to Borden.	She pulls him in, trying to draw him into a kiss, but he backs away.
Olivia looks at him.	Cold.
Borden watches her move down the hall.
Olivia comes back in, half-dressed.
Angier walks out from the lobby.	The two MEN he saw before are loading up their automobile.	Smiling, laughing.
The coach pulls to a stop.	Angier and the driver look up. A plume of SMOKE is rising from further up the hill.

Angier rounds the bend in the road and comes into view of the laboratory.	He FREEZES.The fence has been TORN DOWN.	Beyond it, the LAB has been BURNED TO THE GROUND.	The metal tower is in SMOLDERING PIECES.	Everything else is gone.Angier notices a piece of metal lying in the road near him, and, using his cane, flips it over.	It's Alley's sign warning trespassers to keep out.

scenes.heading: EXT. CLEARING, PIKE'S PEAK -- MOMENTS LATER

actions.content: Angier takes down the picture of Julia from the mantel.	He studies it a second then puts it in the top of his packed suitcase.

scenes.heading: INT. ANGIER'S ROOM, CLIFF HOUSE INN -- EVENING

dialogue.content: We're sorry to see you go, Mr. Angier.
We are sorry to see Mr. Tesla leaveas well.	He was very good to Colorado Springs.	A very generous man.
Mr. Angier?
(Angier turns)
I didn't feel it was necessary to tell the other men about the box.

actions.content: The BELLBOYS wrestle with Angier's cases as Angier walks to the reception desk.	The manager smiles up at him.
Angier takes out his wallet and begins laying down bills.
Angier smiles up at him, absently and begins to leave.
Angier stops.What box? The manager smiles.

scenes.heading: INT. LOBBY, CLIFF HOUSE INN -- MORNING

dialogue.content: We never use these rooms in the off - season.	It's a shame.

actions.content: Angier follows the manager down a darkened hallway.
The manager stops at a set of DOUBLE DOORS and unlocks them. He pushes them open and ushers Angier through.

scenes.heading: INT. HALLWAY, CLIFF HOUSE INN -- MORNING

dialogue.content: My dear Angier, you will find what you were looking for in the box.	I apologize for leaving without saying goodbye...

actions.content: Angier steps into the massive, elegant room.Standing on the dance floor is an ENORMOUS SHIPPING CRATE. Stencilled on one side "COLORADO SPRINGS"Angier walks up to the huge crate, awestruck.An envelope addressed to him has been stuck to the front. Angier stops it and begins to read.

scenes.heading: INT. BALLROOM, CLIFF HOUSE INN -- CONTINUOUS

dialogue.content: Alley has written you a thorough set of instructions.	I add only one suggestion on using the machine-

actions.content: The open crate sits empty at the side of a derelict stage. Angier, in shirt sleeves is running cables to the MACHINE, which is standing center stage.

dialogue.content: Tesla's warning is as unheard as he knew it would be.	Today I tested the machine...
Taking precautions in case Tesla hadn't ironed out the kinks in its operation...
...if it went wrong I would not want to live like that for long...
But here, at the Turn,	I must leave you, Borden...

actions.content: Angier moves to one side of the stage where he makes a hash mark with a piece of chalk.
He loads A GUN and places it next to the machine.
Angier THROWS THE SWITCH.	The machine GROANS into LIFE- SPARKING and GLOWING as it gets up to full power.
Angier closes his eyes for an instant, listening to its power, then THROWS HIMSELF INTO THE MACHINE.	HE IS CONSUMED BY LIGHT...
The WHITS becomes handwriting an a page and we are-

dialogue.content: Stop it!	Just stop it!
Deny it all you want- I know!

actions.content: Jess sits at the foot of the stairs, listening to her parents SHOUT at each other in the living room.	She is CRYING.

dialogue.content: Sarah, it's not true!	I've told you Olivia means nothing to me!
I'll go yo her!	I know what youreally are, Alfred!
(quietly firm)
Sarah.	You can't do that.

actions.content: Sarah is WILD, eyes red, hair a mess.	Utterly DISTRAUGHT Borden is trying to calm her.

scenes.heading: INT. LIVING ROOM, BORDEN'S HOUSE -- CONTINUOUS

dialogue.content: I'll do what I have to!
Sarah, you can't talk like this!

actions.content: Jess looks up. Fallon is standing above her.	Listening.
Jess reaches up a hand.	Fallon takes it in his.

dialogue.content: I can't live like this!
(angry)
What do you want from me!
(quiet)
I want you to be honest with me.	No tricks, no lies, no secrets.
Do you love me?
Not today.
(whispers)
Thank you.

actions.content: Sarah turn to face Borden.	Deperate.
Sarah pauses.	Catches her breath.
Borden calms.	Looks into her eyes.	Nods.
Borden looks into her eyes.	Sincere.
Sarah takes this in.	Borden watches, helpless.
Borden watches her turn away from him.

scenes.heading: INT. LIVING ROOM, BORDEN'S HOUSE -- CONTINUOUS

actions.content: Jess reaches up to Fallon with her other hand.	He takes her gently in his arms.	We stay on Jess's tear-stained face over Fallon's shoulder as he carries her up the stairs.

CLOSE ON A POSTER: Borden, in costume, looking intense: THE PROFESSOR- MASTER OF DARK FORCES.	As we PULL BACK we hear a GENTLE CREAKING... PULL BACK past a hanging PAIR OF FEET, one shoe missing... wider shows up that it is SARAH, HANGING BY HER NECK FROM A BEAM IN THE MIDDLE OF THE SHOP.	Gently swinging.

Cutter is finishing his meal at the bar. He goes to take a swig from his pint and FREEZES- at the bottom of the glass: A PLAYING CARD.	He looks around the bar.		No one he recognizes.	He reaches into the glass.Cutter pulls out the card- an ADDRESS is written up one side.
Cutter	walks along labyrinthine streets. Stops at an ABANDONED THEATRE. He looks up at the building, then enters.

dialogue.content: Who's there
I- I'm looking for an old friend-
I heard about a booking...
Nice little theatre.	Good up-and- coming magician.
You came back.
It's a good to see you, John.
Good rehearsal space.	Blind stagehands.	I like it-
(knowing smile)
You always had an eye for publicity.
I need your help,	John.	My last show.	A limited engagement.
Your last show?
A wise man once told me that obsession was a young man's game.	I'm almost done.	One thing left...
(points at crate)
The real Transported Man.
You want to design a show around it?
i don't want you backstage,	I need you front of house, managing.
i need you calling in any favours and connections you have left to get us the right booking for the run.
What sort of booking are you after?
The sort that Borden can't ignore.

actions.content: Cutter makes his way past the tattered box office and into the derelivt auditorium. In the middle of the room is the CRATE.	Cutter stands and stares at it.
Cutter turns.	Angier is behind him, leaning on his cane. Beside Angier is a SECOND BLIND STAGEHAND.
Cutter sizes Angier up.	Looks around the theatre.
Angier sits in one of the stalls.	Cutter follows suit.
Cutter stares at the crate.
Cutter considers this.	Uncertain.

dialogue.content: This is the address, sir.

actions.content: A long, expensive CARRIEGE creeps out to a halt outside the abandoned theatre, and the confused driver pulls over.
The carriage opens, an imposing man in his 50's steps out, looks the place up and down, then heads inside.

dialogue.content: Mr.Ackerman.	It's an honor to see you again, sir.
When you said you only wanted to show me one trick it piqued my interest.
It's a very special trick. Mr.Ackerman.
Pleased to meet you, Mr. Ackerman.
Likewise, I'm sure.	Let's get on, shall we?
(down to stage)
Turn it on, please.
Very pretty.
That's it, Cutter?	He simply disappears?	That's not a trick.	He has to come back.	There has to be a-
-a Prestige?
Exactly-
(quiet, haunted)
Pardon me.	It's very rare to see... real magic.	it's been many years since I've seen...
Are you interested in helping us?
(nods)
Yes. But you'll have to dress it up a little.	Disguise it.	Give them enough reason to doubt it.

actions.content: The man enters the auditoruim and stares downat the BRIGHTLY LIT STAGE.Cutter moves quickly up the aisle, hand outstretched.
Ackerman shakes Cutter's hand.
Angier has appeared.
Angier smiles.
After a moment, the machine SPARKS INTO LIFE.	ELECTRIC BOLTS CASCADE from the GLOBE and SPLASH on the stage.
Angier smiles at Cutter and head back down the stage.	he STEPS himself into the machine and DISAPPEARS.The machine SPUTTERS out and is silent.
Ackerman begins to turn around- then STOPS- ANGIER IS STANDING DIRECTLY BEHIND HIM.Ackerman is dumfounded.	He looks back down at the stage.
Anckerman steadies himself;

dialogue.content: (surprised)
Mr. Ackerman.	When they said...I didn't think you'd be here in person.
I have an act for your venue.
(flustered)
Well, of course, sir...But I'm afraid I'm booked.	The Moscow Ballet.They're playing through next year.
Get rid of them.	This is a magical act.	An excellent one.	I believe you booked his first engagement several years ago.	The Great Danton.
You really want me to- Ackerman stands.
I'll do it.	Of course.
(smiles)
There will be one hundred performances.	No more, no less. Five perfomances a week.	No matinees, no weekends.
(smiles)
And that's what you'll be charging for each ticket.	Good day.

actions.content: Merrit sits eating a sandwich.	The door to his office opens and ACKERMAN strides in.	Merrit STRUGGLES to his feet.
Ackerman sits without being asked to.
Ackerman picks up a pen and paper from Merrit's desk.
Ackerman scribbles onto the paper and hands it to Merrit.
Ackerman sweeps out of the room, leaving Merrit dumbfounded, staring at the scrap of paper in his hands.

scenes.heading: INT. STAGE MANAGER'S OFFICE, PANTAGE'S THEATRE -- DAY

dialogue.content: You haven't spopken about her, Freddy. Not once.
Who?
Don't be cruel.
Why would I talk about her to you?
Because she was part of your life and now she's gone.
She wanted to meet me the day before she killed herself.	Said she had something to tell me about you.
(looks away)
I was such a coward, I couldn't bring myself to face her.
(looks at Borden)
What would she have said, I wonder?
(snaps)
You want the truth about me, Olivia?
(she nods, wary)
I never loved Sarah.
(appalled)
You married her, had a child with her-
Part of me loved her.	But part of me didn't.		The part that found you. The part that's sitting here now.	I love you.	That is the truth that matters.
You could be sitting in some other restaurant talking to some otherwoman about me that way.	It's unhuman to be so cold.
By the way, have you seen who's opened at the Pantages?
(Borden shakes head)
The Great Danton.
He's back?
After two years.	And he has a new trick.	They're saying it's the best that London's ever seen.
If you could see the look on your face, Professor.	You should go to him- you deserve each other.

actions.content: Olivia and Borden are seated across from each other, finishing their meal.	Olivia watches Borden eat.
Borden says nothing.
Olivia tosses her napkin on her plate.
Borden watches her rise from the table.	She looks at him.
Borden cannot hide his reaction.
Olivia smiles at him and leaves.

dialogue.content: Ladies and gentlemen, my first trick of the evening is one that involves considerable risk.
(removes his coat)

Anyone in the audience who would be irrevocable damaged by seeing a man drown should leave now, for when I tell you that the young lady who taught performing it, you will understand the seriousness of the danger involved.

actions.content: Borden, in disguise, takes his seat halfway along the aisle. The lights dim.	Curtains RISE on a simple stage.	Bare except for a WATER-FILLED GLASS TANK.Borden STIFFENS in his seat, perplexed.Angier limps onto the stage.	Addresses the audience.
Borden watches the hook descend from the flies.	Remembering.INSERT CUT: Borden STARES as Angier desperately BRUSHES the water from Julia's face.

dialogue.content: In my travels I have seen the future, and it is a strange future indeed. The world is on the brink of new and terrifying possibilities.
Man's reach exceeds his IMAGINATION!

actions.content: Angier steps forward as another curtain is drawn up behind him, revealing TESLA'S MACHINE.

The audience RECOILS in terror as the MACHINE is STARTED and BOLTS fly from it.	SMOKE drift over the audience.Borden inches forward in his seat.	Angier stands in front of the machine, silhouetted by the FRENZY of electricity behind him.	He TOSSES his cane to his assistant and steps into the machine.The audience SCREAMS as large bolts BLAST from the machine and wrap themselves around ANGIER'S ARMS and legs.Borden is watching very carefully.	Angier is almost impossible to see as the machine builds to a climax, but, just before it does; Borden catches a glimpse of ANGIER'S BODY FALLING THROUGH A TRAP DOOR.The machine sputters out.	Angier has DISAPPEARED.	The lights are dim.	A FOLLOW SPOT FIRES into the BOXES, audience looks up with a gathering commotion-ANGIER IS STANDING ON THE RAIL OF THE ROYAL BOX, thirtyfeet above stalls. He smiles down at the audience.
The audience breaks into a MASSIVE STANDING OVATION.

dialogue.content: Why only 100 performances?	Do his methods dictate it, or is it simply a publicity move?
Fifty yards in a second.	And all I know is that he uses a trapdoor.What's going on under that stage?

actions.content: Fallon is at the workbench, staring at a sketch of Tesla's machine.	Borden paces, AGITATED.
Borden walks back and stares at the sketch.
The theatre is closed, and tree BLIND STAGEHANDS are wreastling a TARP-WRAPPED BOX onto a cart in the alleyway behind the theatre.Fallon is watching from the shadows.
Fallon shadows the cart as it slowly makes its way.

dialogue.content: Not knowing if I'd be the Prestige....
Or the man in the box...

actions.content: A drowing tank, identical to the one we have already seen. A blind stagehand sits behind it, smoking.
Suddenly, a trap door flashes open as Angier falls from the stage door and SPLASHES into the tank.	The lid snaps shut.
Angier pounds on the glass, frantic.	The blind stagehand continues smoking.	Oblivious.

scenes.heading: INT. UNDER THE STAGE -- EVENING -- FLASHBACK

actions.content: Two hands SLAM shut on the lid of a birdcage. The blind stagehand are wrestling a LARGE CRATE onto a cart in the alleyway behind the theatre.

Fallon watches from further down in the alley as the Blind Stagehands unload the box onto a dolly and wheel it through the stage door. He moves closer, then STOPS. Seeing something. CUTTER has emerged from a nearby doorway and slipped through the stage door.

dialogue.content: WHO'S THERE!
It's Cutter.
What do you want?
I'm looking for Angier.
You found him.
I told you, John- I don't want you backstage on this one.
What are they doing?
Disposing of the Prestige materials.
What's down there? Angier looks at him, serious.
Perhaps not.

actions.content: The blind stagehand wheel the tarp-covered box to two LARGE METAL DOORS in the floor of the auditorium and start hooking it up to a winch.	The metal doors open with a metal HOWL... Cutter slips down the aisle.	WATCHING.
The man turns precisely to Cutter, flasing his white eyes.
Cutter turns.	Angier approaches.
Cutter looks down at the BLACK HOLE in the floor.
Do you really want to know? Cutter considers Angier's grave tone.
Cutter leaves by the stage door.

dialogue.content: They do this every night.	After each performance?
We're done.
(turns to Fallon)
Let him have this trick.	You're not to go back there.		I don't need to know his secret.	Leave him alone.

actions.content: Borden sits at his work bench.	Fallon fiddles with his howler hat.

Fallon nods.	Borden gets to his feet with a sigh.	Turns to a POSTER on the wall- "The Great Danton Perform THE REAL TRANSPORTED MAN- 100 SHOWS ONLY" He studies the image of Angier.	There is a small DEVIL looking over his shoulder.
Fallon puts on his hat with a shrug.

A packed house.	Many hands raised.	Move in on a BEARDED MAN, his gloved hand tentatively rising into the air. IT IS BORDEN. A GLAMOROUS ASSISTANT beckons Borden from the aisle.	He shuffles along his row towards her.	Embarrassed.Borden and four other VOLUNTEERS follow the Assistant down towards the stage...On which stands Angier, leaning on his cane, smiling.	Looming over him is the large and complex ELECTRICAL MACHINE.	Borden STARES at the machine as he mounts the stage.Borden, FASCINATED, and the other volunteers look over the vast machine.	As Angier GESTURES theatrically at the various features of the metal and glass apparatus.As the Assistant leads the Volunteers to the side of the stage, Borden slips through the gas at the side of the curtains-

dialogue.content: Where'd you think you're going?
I'm part of the act, you fool!

BOTLS curl themselves around him.ANGIER HURLS HIMSELF INTO THE LIGHT.This time we do not cut away.The machine sputters out.ANGIER IS STILL STANDING BENEATH IT.
Angier turns...ANOTHER ANGIER is standing on the chalk hashmark, STEAM rising off his shoulders.The first Angier lunges for the pistol and levels it at the second Angier.
BANG!	BANG!	The firt Angier FIRES TWO SHOTS and, grim- faced, drops the pistol.	SHOCKED.	He stumbles back, in a daze, clothes still steaming.

A CART pulls up to the side of the theatre.Cutter and two WORKMEN step down from the cart and move to the back of it. Cutter pulls the tarp off the back of the cart.  Underneath it is the MACHINE's CRATE.

dialogue.content: Thank-you gents.
Where do you want it?
Don't worry.	Someone's coming to help.

actions.content: The crate is sitting on the dolly in the auditorium.
The workmen levae.	Cutter looks at the crate. Angier emerges from the darkness.

dialogue.content: I'm bringing this over after we're done.
Cautions as ever, Cutter.	No one's going to use the place.	I own it.

actions.content: Angier and Cutter load the crate onto a platform suspended by a rope.	Angier pulls open the two metal doors sunk into the floor.Cutter begins turning a WHICH, lowering the crate into the HOLE.	Angier indicates a pile of bricks and a bag of sand.

dialogue.content: No room left- you couldn't have acommodated 100 performances.
It's a good thing I retired early then.
We'll put it down the end.
I'll go mix the cement.
Take a minute to consider your achiviement.
Cutter, I tried not to involve you.

actions.content: Angier slowly climbs down a ladder from the hole to join Cutter in the darkness below.Cutter is standing next to the platform and the crate.	The only night comes from a LANTERN Angier is carrying.	We can see only a small flicker of the high moldy walls of the cellar, but it is a large open space.
Angier puts the lattern and his cane on the lif of the crate and the two men heft ir off the platform.

Angier and Cutter move into the darkness with the crate. From the small pool of light afforded by the lattern, we can see that they are navigating their way through a large space filled with LARGE GLASS BOXES.They arrive at the end and set the crate down.
Cutter looks at Angier, cold.
Cutter turns.
Cutter looks at Angier.	Nods.	Then disappears into darkness.
Cutter comes across the stage and up through the auditorium. Fallon is coming in the other direction. As they pass they nod gravely at each other.

dialogue.content: (whisper)
No one cares about the man in the box.
(calling)
Cutter?

actions.content: Angier is alone bather in the lgiht of the lantern.	He turns to the nearest glass box and smoothes a hand along its face.
Behind him, a NOISE.
No responses.

dialogue.content: (tense)
CUTTER?
(weak)
You- you died.
A brother.	A Twin.

actions.content: Angier PEERS down the row of glass boxes with the lantern.

Angier FREEZES.	He can hear a small THUD, THUD, THUD getting closer, approaching from the darkness...Angier FLINCHES as a RUBBER BALL bounces into the light-Angier DROPS his cane to CATCH the ball.	He turns it around in his hands, confused.Light EXPLODES around him as a GUNSHOT rings out.Angier stands for a moment, confused, staring at the ball, then COLLAPSES to the ground, clutching at his stomach.Fallon's BOWLER HAT breaks into the circle of light.	he is holding a smoking pistol...Angier drops the ball and it rolls across the floor, coming to rest at Fallon's feet.	But it is not Fallon's gloved hand that picks up the ball--it is a MUTILATED HAND, WITH 2 1/2 FINGERS MISSING.	Angierlooks up:ALFRED BORDEN REMOVES THE BOWLER HAT AND TAKES A BOW.
Borden shakes his head. Realization sweeps over Angier like a nightmare.

dialogue.content: You were Fallon.	The whole time...

actions.content: Fallon DROPS into the coffin.	As fallon stares up at us, WE SEE, FOR THE FIRST TIME,	SOMETHING FAMILIAR IN HIS FACE -- FALLON IS REALLY BORDEN IN DISGUISE.
Fallon/Borden's face disappears as Cutter seals his coffin.

dialogue.content: We were both Fallon.	And we were both Borden.
Were you the one who went into the box-

actions.content: Borden smiles.
Angier considers this.	Minds spinning.

dialogue.content: Cutter knew.	 But I told him it was too simple.	Too easy.
Simple, maybe. But not easy.

actions.content: Angier stares up at Borden.	Appalled.

dialogue.content: What about Olivia?	And your wife?
We each loved one of them.	We each had half a full life.	Enough for us, but not for them.
Sacrifice, Robert- that's the price of a good trick.
But you wouldn't know anything about that, would you?
(very quiet)
I've made sacrificies.
It takes nothing to steal someone else's work.
It takes everything.

actions.content: Borden stares at his mutilated hand clasping the rubber ball.
Borden puts the ball in his pocket.	Tears in his eyes.
Borden looks down at Angier with contempt.
Angier is dying.	He opens his mouth to talk, but his voice is so wak that Borden has to stoop to hear him.

dialogue.content: (weaker)
Do you want to see what it cost me? You didn't see where you are, did you?	Let me show you.
It took courage to climb into that machine every night...

actions.content: Angier looks down, a slight smile on his face.	He gestures to the lantern.
Angier slumps to the floor as he tries to reach for the lantern.	He can't his hand to obey him.

dialogue.content: (scorn)
You spent a fortune.	You did terrible things... and all of it for nothing. You went halfway around the world.
Nothing?	You never understood, id you?	Why we did this?
(coughs)

The audience knows the truth- that the world is simple.	Miserable.Solid all the way through.	But if you could fool them, even for a second, you could make them wonder. Then you got to see something very special...
(coughs, looks up)
You really don't know?
It was the look on their faced.
Every magic trick consists of three parts, or acts...

actions.content: Angier stops trying tomove and leans back, resigned.
Angier looks up at him with his last spark of competitiveness.
Borden just stares at Angier.	Who smiles.
Angier's body TOPPLES over, KNOCKING over the lantern.	Borden steps back as the oil spreads, flamming, fro the lantern.
Borden watches Angier for a moment, then turns to leave.

dialogue.content: The second part is called the Turn. I take the ordinary something...

actions.content: The burning lamp oil SPREADS LIGHT through the cellar...
Angier lies in his pooling blood.Angier's eyes move around, looking at the shapes around him increasing illuminated by the hellish light...

dialogue.content: Now you're looking for the secret...
But you won't find it...
...because you don't really want to know...

actions.content: Borden STOPS at the ladder.	He notices the shadows from the burning oil playing on the walls...
Borden turns slowly to look back into the cellar,	PEERING into the flickering light of the burning lamp oil.
Borden stares back into the cellar.	What he sees puts a look on his face that is beyond words:LARGE GLASS TANKS.	DOZENS OF THEM.	ROW AFTER ROW STRECHING INTO THE CAVERNOUS CELLAR.
FLOATING IN BACH AND EVERY TANK, DRESSED IN ROTTING STAGE CLOTHES, IS YET ANOTHER ROBERT ANGIER.
Cutter spreads MORTAT on the last BRICK of the wall he has built in the opening to the cellar.He places the brick in the wall, sealing it up.

dialogue.content: Every magic trick consists of three part, or acts...
The first part is called the Pledge...
...the magician shows you something ordinary-
A deck of cards, ar a bird...

actions.content: Moving along a row of CANARIES in CAGES.
Stop at a cage.	Weathered HANDS envelope the canary.	Hands and voice belongs to a man in his 60's- CUTTER.
A LITTLE GIRL pershes on a chest in the workshop, watching.
Cutter moves to a small ORNATE CAGE resting on a prop table.

dialogue.content: The second act is called the Turn...

actions.content: Cutter gently places the canary into the ornate cage.

dialogue.content: Now you're looking for the secret.

actions.content: Cutter places a SILK SHAWL over the cage. Then SLAMS his hands down on the shawl, which FLATTENS- The Little Girl FLINCHES.  Then STARES, FASCINATED.

dialogue.content: ...you want to be fooled.
But you couldn't clap yet. Because making something disappear isn't enough... you have to bring it back.

actions.content: Cutter WHIPS the shawl from the table.	Cage and bird have DISAPPEARED.
The Little Girl stares, EXPECTANT.

dialogue.content: ...the part we call...

actions.content: Cutter forms a fist.	Drapes the shawl over it.
Cutter WHIPS	the shawl away to reveal- the CANARY.	The Little Girl CLAPS.

dialogue.content: The first part is called the Pledge.

actions.content: The workshop from the opening of the film. We now recognize it as Borden's. Cutter performs the bird cage trick for the Little Girl we now know as Jess.
Cutter is showing far the canary.

dialogue.content: But you wouldn't clap yet.
Because making something disappear isn't enough...
You have to bring it back.

actions.content: Cutter WHIPS the shawl away-	cage and bird have disappeared.
Jess stares, EXPECTANT.	Cutter hols up his handkerchief- covered hand...
Cutter whips the handkerchief from his hand, revealing a canary.	Just then, Jess SEES something and JUMPS off the chest, running past him...

BORDEN IS IN THE DOORWAY- JESS LEAPS INTO HIS ARMS.	Bordenholds her tight.	Looks at Cutter, who is putting on his coat.	Nods.	Cutter leaves.Borden reaches into his pocket and hand Jess his rubber ball. She smiles, then buries her head in his neck.
